intro: Hebe diosmifolia, commonly known as the silver hebe, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the Plantaginaceae family and is characterized by its silvery-gray foliage and spikes of blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, preferring well-drained soils and full sun. Hebe diosmifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature. It is also noted for its ability to thrive in coastal areas, making it a versatile choice for landscaping.
